page.title: 18The Game 'May I?'
page.content: 'May I?' is a game played by any number of children. One person is on and calls to a named person to undertake a particular task such as 'take two strides' or imitate an 'umbrella' - a 'lamp post' or a 'train'. To imitate an umbrella requires a twirl in the air, whereas a lamp-post requires the person to lie down on the ground, stretch out his arms and then stand up at the point where the arms reached. The train requires the person to run backwards and forwards until told to stop. The game is given the name 'May I?' because when the person who is on gives an instruction, should the person who obeys fail to ask 'May I?' that person has to start all over again. The person who reaches the end of a marked pitch first is next on.
